response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Even and Odd Digits\", \"description\": \"Write a function `even_odd` that takes an integer as input and returns the count of even and odd digits separately. The output should be a tuple in the format `(even, odd)`. For example, if the input is 1389, the output should be (2, 3).\", \"code\": \"def even_odd(n: int) -> tuple:\\n    even = 0\\n    odd = 0\\n    for digit in str(n):\\n        if int(digit) % 2 == 0:\\n            even += 1\\n        else:\\n            odd += 1\\n    return (even, odd)\", \"tests\": [\"assert even_odd(1389) == (2, 3)\", \"assert even_odd(10000000) == (5, 0)\", \"assert even_odd(1234567) == (3, 4)\", \"assert even_odd(1111) == (0, 4)\"] }"
